title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 §§ 8186-24.8 - Stratification of the utility class and appraisal of sample parcels
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 §§ 8186-24.8 - Stratification of the utility class and appraisal of sample parcels

State Regulations
(a) A utility class
is initially designated as a single "S" interval. The sample parcels to be
appraised for the value interval shall be selected according to the following
criteria: (1)

At least two sample parcels
shall be selected where possible. (2)

Any parcel or economic unit for which an
appraisal is available shall be selected as a sample parcel. (3)

Where no appraisals are available for any
parcel or economic unit in the class, the largest economic units should be
selected as sample parcels where possible. (b) If no samples can be appraised for the
class, the entire class is redesignated as a single "U" interval. Notes
